oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibitions; Exhibition buildings; Festivals; Fairs; Anniversaries; Lakes & ponds; Waterwheels; Water power; Dams
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of Lake Katherine, located at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition in Nashville, Tennessee.

Lake Katherine was named after "Bonnie Kate" Sevier, the second wife of Tennessee's first Governor, John Sevier. The dam and waterwheel are shown at the center of the photograph. The waterwheel came from an area near Nashville called the Leatherwoods. A Lithia water stand was just beyond the dam, and the Minerals and Forestry Building stood to the left.
